bug.author: manybodycpa
bug.summary: Errors in 1.0.0 on login and creating task
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>My actions before raising this issue</denchmark-h>
Read/searched the docs Searched past issues
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected Behaviour</denchmark-h>
Installed latest version in new directory. Expected working system. <denchmark-h:h3>Current Behaviour</denchmark-h>
Ended up with Server 1.0 Core 0.5.2 Canvas 0.5.2 UI 0.5.2 with error messages appearing on login: Could not get formats from the server TypeError: (intermediate value).map is not a function and when trying to create a task: Could not create the task Error: Request failed with status code 400. {"image_quality":["This field is required."]}. <denchmark-h:h3>Possible Solution</denchmark-h>
Problems may be related to previous installation of version 0.5.2 in different directory? <denchmark-h:h3>Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)</denchmark-h>
Install CVAT according to instructions. Login Try to create task
<denchmark-h:h3>Context</denchmark-h>
Trying to switch from version 0.5.2 to 1.0.0. <denchmark-h:h3>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Git hash commit (git log -1): 0934d77 Docker version docker version (e.g. Docker 17.0.05): 19.03.8 Are you using Docker Swarm or Kubernetes? No Operating System and version (e.g. Linux, Windows, MacOS): Ubuntu 18.04

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zonxin>@zonxin</denchmark-link> when you create the task the client makes 2 requests: post at the endpoint and there is no field required post at : the field is required for this request

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/azhavoro>@azhavoro</denchmark-link> That's it! It is because my server upgrade fails, and endpoint of previous version requires . The upgrade fail comes from that python av module requires ffmpeg>=3.2, but the version installed from source is 2.8.15 using Docker image ubuntu16.04. May I have to install latest ffmpeg manually?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/azhavoro>@azhavoro</denchmark-link> Yes, I am in China. The repo is very slow due to some reasons, so I delete the repo and install some related packages manually. However, installing ffmpeg manually is very boring.

I tried a little last night with 18.04, but I did not find gstreamer-ffmpeg for ubuntu above 16.04. In addition, some dependencies of gstreamer0.10-ffmpeg can not be found in 18.04 main repository. I wonder the package will not work properly in ubuntu > 16.04. Now I have solved my problem by downloading related packages and making a local repository.
